thread.title: Ford: Danica Patrick's car will be on track and ready to perform
thread.title_full: Ford: Danica Patrick's car will be on track and ready to perform

author: USA TODAY Sports
title: Ford: Danica Patrick's car will be on track and ready to perform
text:
Ford: Danica Patrick's car will be on track and ready to perform Despite sponsorship shortfalls, Ford Performance says Danica Patrick's No. 10 will be on race track one way or another. Post to Facebook Ford: Danica Patrick's car will be on track and ready to perform Despite sponsorship shortfalls, Ford Performance says Danica Patrick's No. 10 will be on race track one way or another.  //usat.ly/2kGkC2P   Join the Nation's Conversation To   Ford: Danica Patrick's car will be on track and ready to perform Brant James, USA TODAY Sports 5:08 p.m. ET Feb. 6, 2017 Danica Patrick will drive a Ford for the first time in her NASCAR career this season. (Photo: Jerome Miron, USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Dave Pericak, the global director of Ford Performance, said Monday that Danica Patrick’s No. 10 Ford will remain on the race track this season “one way or another” despite major sponsorship shortfalls. 
Stewart-Haas Racing, which switched to Ford from Chevrolet beginning this season, filed a breach of contract lawsuit in North Carolina superior court last week seeking to recover more than $31 million from Nature’s Bakery in unfulfilled obligations and damages stemming from its commitment as Patrick’s primary sponsor. Nature’s Bakery informed the team Jan. 19 it intended to terminate the deal. 
SHR as an organization has multiple sponsor shortfalls, with new teammate Clint Bowyer also without a benefactor for numerous upcoming races in the Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series season, which begins with the Feb. 26 Daytona 500. Bowyer is replacing team co-owner Tony Stewart, who retired from NASCAR’s premier series after last season. The organization said in a statement the lawsuit will not affect its “on-track efforts.” 
Adding four-car SHR, which includes former series champions Kevin Harvick and Kurt Busch, gives Ford more cars on the track and therefore more chances for victory, but also a broader swath of information to advance the company’s efforts against Chevrolet and Toyota. The last time Ford won a Cup championship was in 2004, with Busch at then-Roush Racing. 
RELATED COVERAGE: Kevin Harvick anxious to get on the racetrack after switch to Ford 
Manufacturers generally allow teams to handle sponsor business, but Pericak — while not committing company resources to the venture — expressed confidence during a national teleconference that Patrick’s season would not be compromised. 
“What I can say is you have my commitment and the commitment of Stewart-Haas Racing and everyone that’s involved, that it is not going to affect our ability to hit the track and run that car and run it the way it needs to be run,” he said. 
“I don’t really want to make any additional comments given where we are in the whole situation and it’s very unfortunate that we are going through it right now, but one way or another I can just tell that you will have that 10 car on the track and it will be ready to perform.” 
Nature’s Bakery sponsored 27 Cup races for Patrick last season and was to back from 20 to 25 this season, the second in a three-year deal. 
The Nevada-based company has not responded to requests for comment from USA TODAY Sports. 
Aspen Dental has committed to four races this season, TaxAct and Code 3 Associates three each for the No. 10. 
Patrick is entering her fifth full-time season. She has six top-10s and a Daytona 500 pole in 154 Cup starts. 
Follow James on Twitter @brantjames 
PHOTOS: Danica Patrick's NASCAR career Facebook Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Danica Patrick, born March 25, 1982, in Beloit, Wis., made her NASCAR Nationwide Series debut in 2010 and her Sprint Cup debut in 2012. Jasen Vinlove, USA TODAY Sports Danica Patrick climbs out of her burning race car after a crash with Matt Kenseth at Talladega Superspeedway on May 1. Patrick called it the worst crash of her career. Marvin Gentry, USA TODAY Sports Danica Patrick finished 16th at Martinsville Speedway on April 3. Michael Thomas Shroyer, USA TODAY Sports Danica Patrick pits while qualifying for the Kobalt 400 at Las Vegas Motor Speedway in March 2016. She started 18th. Stephen R. Sylvanie, USA TODAY Sp Danica Patrick flips the coin at the 2015 GoDaddy Bowl between the Arkansas State Red Wolves and the Toledo Rockets at Ladd-Peebles Stadium in Mobile, Ala., on Jan. 4. Michael Chang, Getty Images Danica Patrick finished a Sprint Cup career-best seventh at the 5-Hour Energy 400 at Kansas Speedway on May 10, 2014. Andrew Weber, USA TODAY Sports Danica Patrick (10) became the first female driver to lead laps at Talladega Superspeedway during the Aaron's 499 on May 4, 2014. Butch Dill, AP Danica Patrick holds Kevin Harvick's son Keelan before the Aaron's 499 at Talladega Superspeedway on May 4, 2014. Rainier Ehrhardt, AP Danica Patrick and country singer Trace Adkins hosted the American Country Awards at the Mandalay Bay Resort & Casino in Las Vegas on Dec. 10, 2013. Frank Micelotta, Invision/AP Danica Patrick (10), the first woman to start from a Cup pole, leads Jeff Gordon (24) to the green flag at the 2013 Daytona 500. Jerry Lai, USA TODAY Sports By virtue of winning the pole, Danica Patrick got to pick the first pit stall for the 2013 Daytona 500. Douglas Jones, USA TODAY Sports Danica Patrick waves to the crowd as she is introduced before the 2013 Daytona 500. Douglas Jones, USA TODAY Sports Danica Patrick waves to her fans after making NASCAR history by becoming the first woman to win a Sprint Cup pole. Patrick qualified first for the 2013 Daytona 500 on Feb. 17. Kevin Liles, USA TODAY Sports Danica Patrick poses with the pole winner sign after becoming the first woman to win the Daytona 500 pole position on Feb. 17, 2013. Chris Graythen, Getty Images Danica Patrick is nothing but smiles as she addresses the media after winning the pole position for the 2013 Daytona 500. Kevin Liles, USA TODAY Sports Danica Patrick was the eighth driver out on the track during qualifying for the 2013 Daytona 500. She posted a speed of 196.434 mph, which held up throughout the day. Douglas Jones, USA TODAY Sports Danica Patrick prepares before heading out onto the track during qualifying for the 2013 Daytona 500. Kevin Liles, USA TODAY Sports Danica Patrick walks from her hauler to her garage during practice for the Daytona 500 on Feb. 17, 2013. Phelan M. Ebenhack, AP Danica Patrick and Ricky Stenhouse Jr. went public with their romantic crelationship in early 2013 after rumors swirled about the fellow Sprint Cup rookies. Chris Graythen, Getty Images Danica Patrick applies makeup before a television interview during NASCAR media day at Daytona International Speedway on Feb. 14, 2013. John Raoux, AP Danica Patrick gets a hand from her crew as she prepares to take the track for qualifying practice for the 2013 Daytona 500. Jonathan Ferrey, Getty Images Danica Patrick has formed a tight bond with her team owner and fellow competitor Tony Stewart. Davis Turner for USA TODAY Sports In preparation for her first full season as a Sprint Cup driver, Danica Patrick speaks with the press during the NASCAR Media Tour on Jan. 21, 2013. Jeff Siner, AP Danica Patrick high-fives fans prior to the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series race at Phoenix International Raceway. Ross D. Franklin, AP Danica Patrick (10) lands on top of Paul Menard during a crash on the final lap of the AdvoCare 500 at Phoenix International Raceway. Jonathan Ferrey, Getty Images for NASCAR Danica Patrick behind the wheel during practice for the AdvoCare 500 at Phoenix International Raceway. Jonathan Ferrey, Getty Images for NASCAR Danica Patrick is introduced before the AAA Texas 500 Sprint Cup race at Texas Motor Speedway. Patrick would go on to finish a career- and season-best 24th. Jerome Miron, US Presswire Danica Patrick takes on tires and fuel during a pit stop at the Nov. 4 AAA Texas 500 Sprint Cup race. Patrick was one of 25 drivers to finish on the lead lap. Tom Pennington, Getty Images Danica Patrick finished 24th at the AAA Texas 500 Sprint Cup race at Texas Motor Speedway on Nov. 4. Jared C. Tilton, Getty Images for NASCAR Danica Patrick waves to the fans during driver introductions at the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series AdvoCare 500 at Atlanta Motor Speedway on Sept 2, 2012 in Hampton, Georgia. By John Harrelson, Getty Images NASCAR Sprint Cup Series driver Danica Patrick during qualifying for the AdvoCare 500 at Atlanta Motor Speedway on Aug 31, 2012. By Kevin Liles, US Presswire Danica Patrick presents the award for Best Team onstage with NBA player Steve Nash at the 2012 ESPY Awards at Nokia Theatre L.A on July 11, 2012. By Kevin Winter, Getty Images Danica Patrick, driver of the #10 GoDaddy.com Chevrolet, leads a group of cars during the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series AAA 400 at Dover International Speedway on Sept 30, 2012. By Tom Pennington, Getty Images Fullscreen Pat Summitt, left, head coach emeritus of the Tennessee women's basketball team, greets Danica Patrick before the Food City 250 NASCAR Nationwide Series auto race on Friday, Aug. 24, 2012, in Bristol, Tenn. Summitt was the grand marshal of the race. By Mark Humphrey, AP Danica Patrick starts her car prior to practice for the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series IRWIN Tools Night Race at Bristol Motor Speedway on Aug 24, 2012 in Bristol, Tennessee. By Jared C. Tilton, Getty Images Danica Patrick sits down for an interview with Pardon the Interruption co-hosts Tony Kornheiser, left, and Michael Wilbon on Feb 21, 2012. By H. Darr Beiser, USA Today NASCAR Sprint Cup Series driver Danica Patrick crashes during the IRWIN Tools Night Race a Bristol Motor Speedway on Aug 25, 2012. By Andrew Weber, US Presswire Danica Patrick waves to fans during driver introductions prior to the start of the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series Daytona 500 at Daytona International Speedway on February 26, 2012 in Daytona Beach, Florida. By Jared C. Tilton, Getty Images for NASCAR Danica Patrick waves before throwing out a ceremonial first pitch before a baseball game between the Houston Astros and the Chicago Cubs in Chicago, Sunday, July 1, 2012. By Nam Y. Huh, AP Danica Patrick greets fans on the grid during qualifying for the NASCAR Nationwide Series Dollar General 300 at Charlotte Motor Speedway on Oct 12, 2012 in Charlotte, N.C. By Tyler Barrick, Getty Images for NASCAR NASCAR Sprint Cup Series driver Danica Patrick (left) leads a pack of cars during the AAA 400 at Dover Speedway on Sept 30, 2012. Jerry Lai, US Presswire NASCAR Sprint Cup driver Danica Patrick (10) talks to the media during practice for the Southern 500 at Darlington Raceway on May 11, 2012. By Peter Casey, US Presswire NASCAR Sprint Cup Series driver Danica Patrick during practice for the Coca-Cola 600 at Charlotte Motor Speedway on May 24, 2012. By Kevin Liles, US Presswire Danica Patrick during practice for the AdvoCare 500 at Atlanta Motor Speedway on Aug. 31, 2012. By Kevin Liles, US Presswire Like this topic?
